name: Bhindi Masala
history: Bhindi Masala, a popular North Indian dish, features okra (bhindi) as the main ingredient. This dish is known for its unique texture and flavorful blend of spices.
description: Bhindi Masala is a spicy and tangy curry made with okra, onions, tomatoes, and a variety of Indian spices. It's a vegetarian dish that pairs well with bread or rice, offering a delightful blend of flavors and textures.

instructions.title: Cook the Okra
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add the okra and fry until they are halfway cooked. Remove and set aside.

instructions.title: Prepare the Masala
instructions.description: In the same pan, add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions are golden.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt to the onions. Cook for a minute, then add tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Combine Okra with Masala
instructions.description: Add the half-cooked okra to the tomato mixture. Cook until the okra is fully cooked and the flavors are well blended.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala over the curry and mix well.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

tips: Ensure the okra is dry before frying to avoid it becoming slimy.
Cook the masala on a low flame to prevent burning and to develop the flavors.
variations: Add a splash of cream for a richer gravy.
Include diced potatoes for a more filling dish.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Accompany with a side of fresh salad or raita.
